alert.note: Alert for Adair; Adams; Audubon; Calhoun; Carroll; Cass; Clarke; Crawford; Dallas; Decatur; Emmet; Greene; Guthrie; Lucas; Madison; Palo Alto; Pocahontas; Ringgold; Sac; Taylor; Union; Wayne (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 11:23AM CST until January 13 at 12:00AM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Dangerous Winter Storm Expected Tonight into Friday Evening... .A multi-faceted winter storms is set to affect Iowa tonight into Friday evening. This dangerous storm starts this evening with snow spreading into the state and persisting into Friday with heavy accumulations. Winds then increase into Friday with near-blizzard conditions, particularly in rural areas along with dangerous wind chills. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT CST FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Wind gusts over 40 mph causing extensive blowing and drifting snow and near-blizzard conditions extending beyond the end of falling snow. Conditions will be particularly dangerous in rural areas. * WHERE...Portions of western into central Iowa. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to midnight CST Friday night. * IMPACTS...Travel is expected to become dangerous by Friday morning, especially in rural areas. Blowing snow is expected to significantly reduce visibility to near-whiteout conditions by midday Friday persisting into early Saturday. The hazardous conditions will greatly impact the morning and evening commutes on Friday. The cold wind chills as low as 10 to 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes and could be potentially life-threatening if stranded outside.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511.
